Recently at work we started a new admin application. There were a few new features that ultimately made their way into the JMesa API and will be part of the upcoming 2.3.3 (early to mid July) release. I thought it would be worthwhile to demo those new features. In addition this is a a great opportunity to show some ways to customize JMesa.

This is what a JMesa looks like on one of our admin screens. Some of the things to notice is that the table columns are grouped, there is a custom header above the normal header, and there is a fancy tooltip hover effect.

http://jmesa.org/wiki/images/group_columns.gif

_This is all just test data which gives me the opportunity to show you what I am working on. You can probably guess I work for a furniture company right now :)._

==== Tag Declaration ====
This is just your basic JMesa tag. The custom work will be done in the !CategoryHierarchyView. 

The reason I have a custom date !CellEditor, !FilterMatcher, and !FilterMatcherMap is because we use !JodaTime for our date handling at work so I needed to create custom classes to handle it. They are pretty straightforward, although I would be happy to show them if developers find it useful.

{{{
<jmesa:tableFacade
    id="categories"
    items="${categoryList}"
    view="com.mycompany.admin.mvc.view.CategoryHierarchyView"
    filterMatcherMap="com.mycompany.admin.mvc.view.DateFilterMatcherMap"
    var="category">
    <jmesa:htmlTable width="700">
        <jmesa:htmlRow>
            <jmesa:htmlColumn property="category.key" title="Key"/>
            <jmesa:htmlColumn property="category.name" title="Name"/>
            <jmesa:htmlColumn property="category.validFrom" title="Valid From" pattern="MM/yyyy" cellEditor="com.mycompany.admin.mvc.view.DateCellEditor"/>
            <jmesa:htmlColumn property="category.validTo" title="Valid To" pattern="MM/yyyy" cellEditor="com.mycompany.admin.mvc.view.DateCellEditor"/>
            <jmesa:htmlColumn property="category.editorialDescription" title="Editorial" filterable="false" sortable="false"/>
            <jmesa:htmlColumn property="category.staticUrl" title="Url" filterable="false" sortable="false"/>
            <jmesa:htmlColumn property="subcategory.key" title="Key"/>
            <jmesa:htmlColumn property="subcategory.name" title="Name"/>
            <jmesa:htmlColumn property="subcategory.validFrom" title="Valid From" pattern="MM/yyyy" cellEditor="com.mycompany.admin.mvc.view.DateCellEditor"/>
            <jmesa:htmlColumn property="subcategory.validTo" title="Valid To" pattern="MM/yyyy" cellEditor="com.mycompany.admin.mvc.view.DateCellEditor"/>
            <jmesa:htmlColumn property="subcategory.staticUrl" title="Url" filterable="false" sortable="false"/>
        </jmesa:htmlRow>
    </jmesa:htmlTable>
</jmesa:tableFacade>
}}}
